author: Jake Maxwell Watts
title: Malaysia Struggles to Try Kim Jong Nam Slaying Without the Chief Suspect: North Korea
text:
SHAH ALAM, Malaysia—Six months into the trial of two women accused of murdering the half-brother of North Korea’s leader, prosecutors have yet to establish a clear motive—raising the prospect no one will be convicted.
The chief investigator had to defend his case Thursday against an increasingly glaring weakness—the absence of the main North Korean suspects, who escaped in the hours after the killing.

... RELATED VIDEO Suspect in Kim Jong Nam’s Killing Simulated Attack in Pranks Security camera footage shows a Vietnamese woman accused of poisoning the North Korean leader’s half brother, Kim Jong Nam, performing a prank at Hanoi's airport that simulated the attack.
